request_pathways.name: Request for Access to Health Information by Patient or Personal Representative
Authorization for Release of Health Information (English)
Fax submission to Northwell Health HIM department
Mail submission to facility HIM department

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: Northwell Health provides a dedicated 'Request for Access to Health Information' form (form-2) citing HIPAA 45 CFR 164.524, separate from the third-party 'Authorization for Release' form, both linked from a well-organized medical records page.

red_flags: No submission instructions on form — patient must independently find where to send completed form
Spanish-language patient access form missing due to website bug (both Spanish links point to third-party authorization form)
bright_spots: Dedicated patient access form citing HIPAA § 164.524 separate from third-party authorization
Companion step-by-step instruction documents with annotated visual examples for both forms
Rich delivery format options including secure/unsecure email, USB, CD, and fax
Parenthetical plain-language glosses on field labels (From Who, To Who)
28 fillable interactive fields for fully digital completion

findability.rationale: Level 4: Forms are easy to find via web search and directly linked from a well-organized Northwell Health medical records page with clear section headings, though patients must navigate from the Phelps Hospital sub-site to the parent system's website.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 4: The patient access form has 28 fillable interactive fields and a clean digital-first design for on-screen completion, but submission requires fax or mail — one gap in an otherwise digital workflow.

content_design.rationale: Level 4: Concise 2-page form with logical numbered sections, plain-language glosses, structured delivery options grid, and companion instruction document; minor issues include dense legal text in the substance use section and absence of submission instructions on the form.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 5: Process is designed around patient self-access as a first-class use case — a dedicated form titled 'Request for Access to Health Information' explicitly cites HIPAA § 164.524, includes a 'To me' checkbox, and is clearly distinct from the separate third-party 'Authorization for Release' form on the website.

compliance.rationale: Level 4: No notarization, no in-person requirement, no unreasonable expiry for patient access requests, explicit HIPAA Right of Access framing, and proper 42 CFR Part 2 handling; minor ambiguity around the witness signature line and no fee disclosure.

overall.summary: Northwell Health provides an exemplary dedicated patient access pathway with fillable forms, explicit HIPAA Right of Access framing, and companion instruction documents, with minor gaps in submission guidance and Spanish-language availability preventing an A grade.
